intro: Marilaunidium stenocarpum, commonly known as the narrow-fruited marilaunidium, is a unique species within the Proteaceae family. It is characterized by its small, leathery leaves and distinctive, narrow, woody fruits. Native to the south-western region of Western Australia, it thrives in sandy soils and is adapted to dry, Mediterranean climates. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in spring. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
